comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content:
On back of picture it reads,

Bellanca Plane
Packard Diesel Engine
Walter E. Lees -Pilot
Fred A. Brossy- Co Pilot
End of the World Duration Record- 84 hours- 32 min
Jacksonville Beach, FLA. May 24-25-26-27- 1930
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 41335030@N04
comment._content:
This photo was taken in 1930 at Jacksonville Beach, Florida by photographer Jack Spottswood of Jacksonville, Florida.
The 3 men in front from left to right are as follows:
1) Co pilot-Fred Brossy 
2) Pilot Walter E. Lees
3) Edward Macauley, chief styling engineer of Packard Motor Company who the son of Alvan Macauley, president of Packard Motor Company from 1916 until 1939.

Edward
